com.cloudera.oryx.als.common.factorizer.als

Class AlternatingLeastSquares

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudera.oryx.als.common.factorizer.als.AlternatingLeastSquares
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MatrixFactorizer, Callable<Object>

    public final class AlternatingLeastSquares
extends Object
implements MatrixFactorizer

    Implements the Alternating Least Squares algorithm described in "Collaborative Filtering for Implicit Feedback Datasets" by Yifan Hu, Yehuda Koren, and Chris Volinsky.

    This implementation varies in some small details; it does not use the same mechanism for explaining ratings for example and seeds the initial Y differently.

    Note that in this implementation, matrices are sparse and are implemented with a LongObjectMap of LongFloatMap so as to be able to use long keys. In many cases, a tall, skinny matrix is needed (sparse rows, dense columns). This is represented with LongObjectMap of float[].

    This implementation implements essentially this function, expressed in Octave/Matlab:

    function [X, Y] = als(R, f, iterations) alpha = 1; lambda = 0.1 * alpha; [m,n] = size(R); P = R > 0; Pnonzero = R != 0; C = 1 + alpha * abs(R); X = zeros(m,f); Y = abs(stdnormal_rnd(n,f)); for i = 1:n Y(i,:) /= norm(Y(i,:)); endfor If = eye(f); Im = eye(m); In = eye(n); for iter = 1:iterations YTY = Y' * Y; for u = 1:m Cu = diag(C(u,:)); count = sum(Pnonzero(u,:)); YTCupu = Y' * Cu * P(u,:)'; YTCuY = YTY + Y' * (Cu - In) * Y; Wu = pinv(YTCuY + lambda * count * If); X(u,:) = (Wu * YTCupu)'; endfor XTX = X' * X; for i = 1:n Ci = diag(C(:,i)); count = sum(Pnonzero(:,i)); XTCipi = X' * Ci * P(:,i); XTCiX = XTX + X' * (Ci - Im) * X; Wi = pinv(XTCiX + lambda * count * If); Y(i,:) = (Wi * XTCipi)'; endfor endfor end
    Author:
    Sean Owen

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlternatingLeastSquares

        public AlternatingLeastSquares(LongObjectMap<LongFloatMap> RbyRow,
                               LongObjectMap<LongFloatMap> RbyColumn,
                               int features,
                               double estimateErrorConvergenceThreshold,
                               int maxIterations)
        Parameters:
        RbyRow - the input R matrix, indexed by row
        RbyColumn - the input R matrix, indexed by column
        features - number of features, must be positive
        estimateErrorConvergenceThreshold - when the average absolute difference in estimated user-item scores falls below this threshold between iterations, iterations will stop
        maxIterations - caps the number of iterations run. If non-positive, there is no cap.

      • call

        public Void call()
          throws ExecutionException,
                 InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: MatrixFactorizer
        Run the factorization algorithm to completion. Results are available from MatrixFactorizer.getX() and MatrixFactorizer.getY() afterwards.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:

        Throws:
